clinical_study.brief_title: Time-restricted Feeding as a Dietary Strategy Against Metabolic Disturbances in Humans
clinical_study.official_title: Time-restricted Feeding as a Dietary Strategy Against Metabolic Disturbances in Humans

brief_summary.textblock: This human dietary intervention study with a cross-over design aims to compare the effects of two isocaloric diets - early time-restricted feeding (TRF) vs. late TRF - on glycemic control and lipid metabolism in overweight females with prediabetes.

detailed_description.textblock: The participants are randomly allocated to one of two study groups: In study group (A) participants will begin with the early TRF (e-TRF) intervention. They will consume their habitual food (and the habitual daily amount of food) between 8 am and 4 pm for two weeks. After a washout-phase participants will conduct the late TRF (l-TRF) and consume their habitual food between 1 pm and 9 pm for another two weeks. Study group (B) receives the same interventions in the reversed order. Both dietary regimens will result in 8-hr eating period and 16-hr fasting period during the 24h day.

primary_outcome.description: Assessed using Matsuda index in oral glucose tolerance test (OGTT)

secondary_outcome.measure: Glucose tolerance, fasting glucose, and overall daily glycemic variation
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by glucose area under the curve in OGTT and using a continuous glucose monitoring system
Levels of hormones related to the glucose metabolism, hormones of appetite regulation, adipokines and inflammatory markers
Total cholesterol, low-density lipoprotein and high-density lipoprotein cholesterol and triglycerides
Assessed using Visual Analog Scales (VAS with a scale of 1-100, where higher values correspond to stronger satiety/hunger)
Assessed by the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI score, which ranges from 0-21, where higher values correspond to worse sleep quality) and also monitored by an ActiGraph device
24-h physical activity will be monitored by an ActiGraph device

secondary_outcome.measure: Expression of metabolic genes in adipose tissue
secondary_outcome.description: RNA-Seq analysis of subcutaneous adipose tissue samples

Assessed by computer tests together with the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale short version (BIS-15 with a score between 15 and 60, where higher values correspond to higher impulsiveness) and the UCLA Loneliness Scale (with a score between 20 and 100, where higher values correspond to higher subjectively perceived loneliness)

intervention.description: Eat between 8 am and 4 pm for two weeks
Eat between 1 pm and 9 pm for two weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BMI 25-35 kg/mÂ²
- Prediabetic as determined by fasting glucose 100-120 mg/dl and/or 2h glucose 140-200 mg/dl in OGTT
Exclusion Criteria:
- prior diagnosis of type 1 or 2 diabetes
- weight changes > 5% within past 3 months
- current shift work or history of shift work
- traveled across more than one time zone one month before the study
- poor quality of sleep (PSQI score<10)
- eating disorders, food intolerance/allergy, severe indigestion
- Pregnant or breastfeeding
- severe internal or psychiatric disorders or other conditions that might influence the outcome of the study
